title: What problems can happen when there are communication breakdowns? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can resort to “The silent treatment” which could either be a temporary disconnection in communication or could be a permanent disconnection. Communication breakdowns can also cause continuous thoughts of what might be going on in the other partner’s head. Are they thinking about you through the breakdown? Or are they just living life comfortably, not even breaking a sweat that you still living or even breathing? Sometimes communication breakdowns can cause handicaps. If the other partner has power over the other. This could resort to a conflict and can make both partners go on world war against each other… no seriously. It does… Sometimes communication breakdowns are good because you get to focus on yourself on what you’ve been missing out on you. However, it can also uncover stuff that you not supposed to find out about the person you having the communication breakdown with… Overall communication breakdowns have their pros and cons but for me they’d be unhealthy in nature. Partners need to communicate to make a solid foundation between them both. Without communication. It’s like isolated from your partner and divided by a concrete wall so you can’t contact each other… I’ve been through a communication breakdown but only because she put me through it… and when I started communicating with her again she was like “Ohh you’re still alive… thought you got sucked into a black hole or something…”

In any relationship, be it personal or business related, communication is key. Period. That said, when it comes to a breakdown in communication, it could signal the ending of a relationship. Problems that arise from a communication breakdown are a strong sense of confusion for whomever is on the receiving end of faltering communication, a feeling of drop in self-respect or self-worth and finding yourself in a state of loneliness. All three of these examples come from a communication breakdown in regards to a personal relationship. To be more concise, think of the feelings experienced after a breakup. As Led Zeppelin mentions in their 1969 track, “Communication Breakdown”, it causes a “nervous breakdown”, which is true. The feeling of left alone without response can drive anyone insane, as lead vocalist Robert Plant goes on to say.
